extendedIngredients.name: shrimp
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 pounds large uncooked shrimp, peeled and deveined

recipes.title: Shrimp in Cream Sauce

winePairing.pairingText: Fish can be paired with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Grüner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Vampire Pinot Grigio Wine with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 18 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Vampire Pinot Grigio Wine
productMatches.description: This dry, zestful combination is reminiscent of ripe pears and roses

recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                In a small saucepan, melt butter; stir in flour until smooth. Gradually add broth and garlic. Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened. Remove from the heat. Stir in the cream, parsley, paprika, salt and pepper.                                                                                           Butterfly shrimp, by cutting lengthwise almost in half, but leaving shrimp attached at opposite side. Spread to butterfly. Place cut side down in a greased 13-in. x 9-in. baking dish. Pour cream sauce over shrimp. Bake, uncovered, at 400° for 15-18 minutes or until shrimp turn pink. Serve with noodles or rice.                                        Yield: 8 servings.                                                                                                                         Originally published as Shrimp in Cream Sauce in  Country Woman ChristmasAnnual 2003, p39                                                                                                                                                                                                        Nutritional Facts                                                                             1 serving (calculated without salt, pepper and noodles or rice) equals 240 calories, 15 g fat (9 g saturated fat), 216 mg cholesterol, 410 mg sodium, 6 g carbohydrate, trace fiber, 20 g protein.                                                                                                                                                                     Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: In a small saucepan, melt butter; stir in flour until smooth. Gradually add broth and garlic. Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened.
Remove from the heat. Stir in the cream, parsley, paprika, salt and pepper.
Butterfly shrimp, by cutting lengthwise almost in half, but leaving shrimp attached at opposite side.
Place cut side down in a greased 13-in. x 9-in. baking dish.
Bake, uncovered, at 400° for 15-18 minutes or until shrimp turn pink.
